page.title: 05BUILDINGS AND MONUMENTS (2)
page.content: {BUILDINGS AND MONUMENTS(2) { } Alne church (continued) The original Norman tower was built in stone and the extension is built in red brick.The tower now has three bells. {The plague stone}is at Alne crossroads In 1604 the plague which during 1603 had killed 30,570 people in London spread to York.To prevent the disease spreading further into the countryside a stone cross was built and a stone bowl placed at the side.Vinegar was put into the bowl to receive and disinfect money from the citizens of York who came out to buy food from the countryfolk of Alne. {Alne Hall}is a large brick mansion built in the 18th century.On the site of an ancient monastic cell.It is now a Cheshire Home for the disabled. {
